title: Typedef
description:
A typedef in C++ is where you rename a function to somthing else. Let's say we have a function Addition(). then, you can use the typedef keyword on the function like this. typedef Addition Add;. this will make the adition function now called add. You can also use typedef on types, like typedef USER_ID int; so now you can use USER_ID as int. 

The CBit OS team needs a quick and easy way to make an array of ten ints, so they need you to make that and define it as ProcessHistory.
